channel.title: Wisconsin Sports (Core Teams)
channel.description: Packers, Bucks, Brewers scores + UW Badgers scores & news.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Boyd's career-day pushes UW past Rutgers
item.description: Behind 32 points from grad student Nick Boyd, the Wisconsin men's basketball team raced past Rutgers, 96-87, on Saturday at the Kohl Center.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Booth, Simon garner Volleyball awards
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - The 2025 Wisconsin volleyball team celebrated their annual program banquet at Union South on Saturday, presenting the winners of the Bring It! and Most Improved Awards.

UW News • Volleyball: Badgers to Play in 2026 AVCA First Serve
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – Mark the calendars as the Wisconsin volleyball team will compete at the 2026 American Volleyball Coaches Association (AVCA) First Serve, held at Milwaukee's Fiserv Forum from August 21-23, 2026.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Blackwell's buzzer-beater lifts UW over Minnesota
item.description: Wisconsin men's basketball junior John Blackwell hit a buzzer-beating three-pointer to lift UW over Minnesota, 78-75, on Tuesday night at the Williams Arena in Minneapolis.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Five Things to Know: UW at Minnesota
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team looks to keep their forward momentum with a rivalry matchup against Minnesota on Tuesday at the Williams Arena in the Twin Cities.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Badgers take down No. 2 Michigan in thriller
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team overcame a 14-point first half deficit to upset No. 2 Michigan, 91-88, at the Crisler Center in Ann Arbor on Saturday

UW News • Women's Basketball: Comeback falls short as Wisconsin falls to Purdue, 75-67
item.description: A fourth-quarter comeback fell short as the Wisconsin women's basketball team (11-5, 3-2 B1G) suffered its first home setback of the season, a 74-67 loss to the Purdue Boilermakers (9-7, 1-4 B1G), on Thursday evening at the Kohl Center.

item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team hits the road for a matinee showdown with undefeated No. 2 Michigan on Saturday at noon in Ann Arbor.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Colyer Named CWSA Honda Cup Finalist
item.description: MADISON, Wis. – After a prolific season with the Wisconsin volleyball team, outside hitter Mimi Colyer has been named a finalist in volleyball for the 2026 Honda Cup – the Collegiate Women Sports Award presented by Honda, announced by the CWSA Wednesday afternoon.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Badgers bludgeon UCLA, 80-72
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team bludgeoned UCLA, 80-72, Tuesday at the Kohl Center as four Badgers reached double-digit scoring.

item.title: Brewers News: Familiar face Vogelbach joins Brewers amid coaching staff shuffle
UW News • Women's Basketball: Badgers claim 74-73 comeback win over Penn State, remain undefeated at home
item.description: A back-and-forth game ended with an electric fourth-quarter comeback for the Badgers as the Wisconsin women's basketball team (11-4, 3-1 B1G) defeated the Penn State Nittany Lions (7-8, 0-4 B1G), 74-73, on Sunday afternoon at the Kohl Center to extend its home win streak to nine games.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Five Things to Know: UW vs. UCLA
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team looks to bounce back against UCLA on Tuesday at the Kohl Center.

item.title: UW News • Men's Basketball: Badgers fall to No. 5 Purdue
item.description: The Wisconsin men's basketball team fell to No. 5 Purdue 89-73 on Saturday at the Kohl Center.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Booth signs with Italian Serie A1 League
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - After an illustrious collegiate career, middle blocker Carter Booth has signed with the Unione Yamamay Busto Arisizio of the Italian Serie A1 League to begin her professional tenure.

item.title: UW News • Women's Basketball: Starting Five: Wisconsin hosts Penn State for first home game of 2026

item.description: Wisconsin erases a 21-point deficit to defeat Rutgers, 70–63

item.description: Badgers unable to spark momentum in first B1G road test

item.title: UW News • Women's Basketball: Starting Five: Badgers head east for first Big Ten road trip
item.description: Wisconsin continues conference play against No. 7 Maryland and Rutgers

item.title: UW News • Football: Wisconsin adds Robert Steeples to staff
item.description: Steeples named cornerbacks coach, Haynes to oversee secondary

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Wisconsin lands at No. 8 in Fall Learfield Directors' Cup
item.description: The National Association of Collegiate Directors of Athletics and LEARFIELD released its Fall Division I Learfield Directors' Cup standings this Tuesday, with Wisconsin placing eighth after a another successful fall season.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Volleyball adds Travis and Hoppe
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - Head coach Kelly Sheffield of the Wisconsin volleyball program has announced the signing of outside hitter Eva Travis from UC Santa Barbara and setter Isabelle Hoppe from Pine-Richland High School in Gibsonia, Pa. Both Travis and Hoppe will arrive for spring semester of 2026.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Volleyball signs standout Auguste
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - Head coach Kelly Sheffield of the Wisconsin volleyball team has announced the signing of AVCA All-American Jaela Auguste after spending a pair of seasons at Florida. Auguste will arrive at UW for the start of the 2026 spring semester.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Colyer named AVCA Outside Hitter of the Year
item.description: KANSAS CITY, Mo. - Senior standout Mimi Colyer was named the American Volleyball Coaches Association Outside Hitter of the Year on Friday morning, fresh off of leading the Wisconsin volleyball team to their seventh appearance in the NCAA Championships and a 28-5 overall record.

item.title: UW News • Volleyball: Badgers season ends in five-set thriller
item.description: KANSAS CITY, Mo. - The No. 3 Wisconsin volleyball team saw their season come to a conclusion in the NCAA National Semifinals versus No. 1 Kentucky (25-12, 22-25, 25-21, 24-26, 13-15) in a five-set thriller.

item.title: Brewers News: Latest Brewers injuries & transactions
UW News • Volleyball: Colyer, Booth earn AVCA All-American honors
item.description: MADISON, Wis. - After a pair of stellar individual seasons, seniors Mimi Colyer and Carter Booth of the Wisconsin volleyball team each garnered All-America honors from the American Volleyball Coaches Association, as announced on Wednesday morning by the AVCA.

item.title: UW News • Football: Wisconsin adds Eric Mateos as offensive line coach
item.description: 15-year coaching veteran joins Badgers after stints at Arkansas, Baylor, BYU, LSU

item.title: UW News • Football: 91 Badgers named to 2025-26 Fall Academic All-Big Ten team
item.description: The Big Ten Conference announced its 2025-26 Fall Academic All-Big Ten teams this Wednesday, with a tremendous 91 student-athletes at the University of Wisconsin-Madison achieving the honor.
